snippet.textDisplay:
Hi! Looks like a lot of feedback on tools, etc. - please can you post that over on our forums? Developers and support can't monitor YouTube comments so would not see your feedback and suggestions here for possible improvements to PBR, so the forums would be the place to share those: https://forum.corona-renderer.com/index.php?board=5.0

(Also, do keep in mind that PBR in this tutorial is now very different in Corona 7 onward, thanks to the new Physical Material, which may have addressed some of your suggested improvements !) Thanks! Tom

snippet.textDisplay:
Not sure what is meant by "smoothness" which is not a feature of the material (smoothing is taken care of by the host application). Sounds like your questions are quite involved, and best thing to do is ask over on the forums where images can be shared to show what you mean, etc. https://forum.corona-renderer.com/index.php for that.

As for the dislikes, "You can please some of the people some of the time..." as the saying goes, nothing ever meets the needs of everyone, though we try our best! And if a video doesn't cover everything, that's what our support team and community is for, over on the forums :) Thanks!
snippet.textOriginal:

As for the dislikes, "You can please some of the people some of the time..." as the saying goes, nothing ever meets the needs of everyone, though we try our best! And if a video doesn't cover everything, that's what our support team and community is for, over on the forums :) Thanks!

snippet.textDisplay: Sorry, not sure what you mean "where is PBR files"? Due to licensing restrictions on texture maps, objects, etc. we don't share scenes with our tutorials, but that should be fine as we explain everything in such a way that you can follow along with your own texture maps and assets that you have on hand. (Also as a note, this tutorial is out of date now anyway for Corona 7 and onward, as we have a new Physical Material in there). Thanks! Tom
snippet.textOriginal: Sorry, not sure what you mean "where is PBR files"?
